elements.title: Global emergence of unprecedented lifetime exposure to climate extremes (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Global emergence of unprecedented lifetime exposure to climate extremes

Climate models, impact models and demographic data are used to estimate the number of people projected to experience unprecedented lifetime exposure to extreme climate events across multiple dimensions, including birth year, warming scenario and vulnerability.

  • Luke Grant
  • Inne Vanderkelen
  • Wim Thiery
ArticleOpen Access07 May 2025

elements.title: Twist-programmable superconductivity in spin–orbit-coupled bilayer graphene (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Twist-programmable superconductivity in spin–orbit-coupled bilayer graphene

The superconductivity in Bernal bilayer graphene that emerges from the spin–orbit coupling induced by proximal tungsten diselenide can be tuned by modulating the twist angle between the two materials.

  • Yiran Zhang
  • Gal Shavit
  • Stevan Nadj-Perge
Article07 May 2025

elements.title: PLA2G15 is a BMP hydrolase and its targeting ameliorates lysosomal disease (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
PLA2G15 is a BMP hydrolase and its targeting ameliorates lysosomal disease

Lysosomal phospholipase PLA2G15 was identified as a physiological BMP hydrolase whose activity depends on unique esterification and stereochemistry of BMP and offers a potential therapeutic target for Niemann–Pick disease type C1 and other neurodegenerative conditions.

  • Kwamina Nyame
  • Jian Xiong
  • Monther Abu-Remaileh
ArticleOpen Access07 May 2025

elements.title: Bioremediation of complex organic pollutants by engineered Vibrio natriegens (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Bioremediation of complex organic pollutants by engineered Vibrio natriegens

A synthetic biology approach was used to engineer Vibrio natriegens into a strain capable of bioremediating complex organic pollutants in saline wastewater and soils, thereby addressing notable threats to marine biosecurity.

  • Cong Su
  • Haotian Cui
  • Hongzhi Tang
Article07 May 2025

elements.title: Intragrain 3D perovskite heterostructure for high-performance pure-red perovskite LEDs (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Intragrain 3D perovskite heterostructure for high-performance pure-red perovskite LEDs

To increase the efficiency, brightness and stability of next-generation light-emitting diodes (LEDs), the microstructure of CsPbI3-xBrx metal-halide perovskite, a good pure-red emitter, was altered to fix hole leakage, which was identified as decreasing efficiencies in overworked LEDs.

  • Yong-Hui Song
  • Bo Li
  • Hong-Bin Yao
Article07 May 2025

elements.title: Light-microscopy-based connectomic reconstruction of mammalian brain tissue (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Light-microscopy-based connectomic reconstruction of mammalian brain tissue

A technique called LICONN (light-microscopy-based connectomics) allows mapping of brain tissue at synapse level and simultaneous measurement of molecular information, thus enabling quantification of cellular properties and multimodal analysis of brain tissue.

  • Mojtaba R. Tavakoli
  • Julia Lyudchik
  • Johann G. Danzl
ArticleOpen Access07 May 2025

elements.title: Oncogene aberrations drive medulloblastoma progression, not initiation (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Oncogene aberrations drive medulloblastoma progression, not initiation

A large-scale multi-omics analysis reports oncogenic alterations that drive medulloblastoma progression, rather than initiation, and the findings show how single-cell technologies can be used for early detection and diagnosis of medulloblastoma.

  • Konstantin Okonechnikov
  • Piyush Joshi
  • Stefan M. Pfister
ArticleOpen Access07 May 2025

elements.title: Striatum supports fast learning but not memory recall (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Striatum supports fast learning but not memory recall

Activity in the striatum is necessary for trial-to-trial improvements in learning sensory–motor tasks but not memory recall.

  • Kimberly Reinhold
  • Marci Iadarola
  • Bernardo L. Sabatini
ArticleOpen Access07 May 2025

elements.title: Heterogeneous pericoerulear neurons tune arousal and exploratory behaviours (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Heterogeneous pericoerulear neurons tune arousal and exploratory behaviours

A set of neurons in the peri-locus coeruleus region controls arousal and avoidance states, providing an understanding of the neurobiological basis of arousal and exploratory behaviours.

  • Andrew T. Luskin
  • Li Li
  • Michael R. Bruchas
Article07 May 2025

elements.title: Dopamine D1–D2 signalling in hippocampus arbitrates approach and avoidance (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Dopamine D1–D2 signalling in hippocampus arbitrates approach and avoidance

Approach versus avoidance responses are driven by D1 and D2 neurons in the ventral hippocampus.

  • Arthur Godino
  • Marine Salery
  • Eric J. Nestler
Article07 May 2025

elements.title: Targeting the SHOC2–RAS interaction in RAS-mutant cancers (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Targeting the SHOC2–RAS interaction in RAS-mutant cancers

A study of dependencies associated with cancer-causing mutations has identified a small molecule that binds to SHOC2 and inhibits RAS signalling in cells carrying NRAS Q61 mutations, a common oncogenic driver in melanoma.

  • Zachary J. Hauseman
  • Frédéric Stauffer
  • Luca Tordella
ArticleOpen Access07 May 2025

elements.title: Herring spawned poleward following fishery-induced collective memory loss (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Herring spawned poleward following fishery-induced collective memory loss

A critically low abundance of older herring due to age-selective fisheries resulted in an approximately 800-km poleward shift in main spawning.

  • Aril Slotte
  • Are Salthaug
  • Erling Kåre Stenevik
ArticleOpen Access07 May 2025

elements.title: Trends in the seasonal amplitude of atmospheric methane (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Trends in the seasonal amplitude of atmospheric methane

Model simulations show that the observed trends in the seasonal amplitude of methane can be attributed to changes in emissions and the atmospheric sink from reaction with the hydroxyl radical.

  • Gang Liu
  • Lu Shen
  • Shushi Peng
Article07 May 2025

elements.title: Native nucleosomes intrinsically encode genome organization principles (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Native nucleosomes intrinsically encode genome organization principles

A technique called condense-seq has been developed to measure nucleosome condensability and used to show that mononucleosomes contain sufficient information to condense into large-scale compartments without requiring any external factors.

  • Sangwoo Park
  • Raquel Merino-Urteaga
  • Taekjip Ha
ArticleOpen Access07 May 2025

elements.title: Superconductivity and spin canting in spin–orbit-coupled trilayer graphene (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Superconductivity and spin canting in spin–orbit-coupled trilayer graphene

Introducing spin–orbit coupling by substrate proximity effect leads to an enhancement of superconducting phases in rhombohedral trilayer graphene.

  • Caitlin L. Patterson
  • Owen I. Sheekey
  • Andrea F. Young
Article07 May 2025

elements.title: Deep origin of eukaryotes outside Heimdallarchaeia within Asgardarchaeota (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Deep origin of eukaryotes outside Heimdallarchaeia within Asgardarchaeota

Ancestral reconstruction together with molecular dating of the last Asgard archaea and eukaryote common ancestor suggest that eukaryotes arose from the fusion of a H2-consuming archaeal host and a H2-producing protomitochondrion.

  • Jiawei Zhang
  • Xiaoyuan Feng
  • Hong-Po Dong
ArticleOpen Access07 May 2025

elements.title: Activation of lysosomal iron triggers ferroptosis in cancer (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Activation of lysosomal iron triggers ferroptosis in cancer

Some cancer cells exhibit high loads of reactive iron in lysosomes, and this feature is exploited by using fentomycin-1, a newly developed small molecule, to induce ferroptosis.

  • Tatiana Cañeque
  • Leeroy Baron
  • Raphaël Rodriguez
ArticleOpen Access07 May 2025

elements.title: Motor learning refines thalamic influence on motor cortex (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Motor learning refines thalamic influence on motor cortex

Imaging and optogenetics in mice provide insight into the interplay between the primary motor cortex and the motor thalamus during learning, showing that thalamic inputs have a key role in the execution of learned movements.

  • Assaf Ramot
  • Felix H. Taschbach
  • Takaki Komiyama
Article07 May 2025

elements.title: A cryptic role for reciprocal helping in a cooperatively breeding bird (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
A cryptic role for reciprocal helping in a cooperatively breeding bird

A study of the cooperative breeding behaviour of superb starlings during 40 consecutive breeding seasons over 20 years reveals long-term reciprocal helping between both related and unrelated individuals.

  • Alexis D. Earl
  • Gerald G. Carter
  • Dustin R. Rubenstein
ArticleOpen Access07 May 2025

elements.title: Chromatin loops are an ancestral hallmark of the animal regulatory genome (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Chromatin loops are an ancestral hallmark of the animal regulatory genome

The physical organization of the genome in non-bilaterian animals and their closest unicellular relatives is characterized; comparative analysis shows chromatin looping is a conserved feature of genome architecture and spatial genome regulation emerged early in animal evolution.

  • Iana V. Kim
  • Cristina Navarrete
  • Arnau Sebé-Pedrós
ArticleOpen Access07 May 2025
